corpora.description: First version of the microtexts corpus. A corpus of 112 argumentative texts, each around 80 words long, annotated with argumentation structures including components and relations.

The News Editorials Corpus, also known as Webis-Editorials-16, is a collection designed to help researchers understand how arguments are structured in news editorials. It includes 300 English news editorials from three major news outlets: Al Jazeera, Fox News, and The Guardian. Each broken down into ADUs, further labelled into different types such as opinions, stories, or statistics
Wikipedia Talk pages discussing content edits where editors discuss article revisions, propose changes, and resolve disputes. These discussions are typically formal yet conversational.

The corpus focuses on online user comments from debate platforms, specifically targeting discussions on controversial social and political issues. Specifically two discussions, one on 'Gay Marriage', and one on 'Under God in pledge'.
